info.title: Model Control Interface
info.description: Control and monitor executable units with linting and persistence options.

clientId.name: X-Client-ID
clientId.description: Client ID to distinguish between different client applications

pid.description: Unique process identifier assigned by the system

description.description: Detailed description of what this process does
examples: Processes customer data from CSV files and loads into the database

status.description: The current execution state of the process

exit_state.description: The final outcome of the process execution. Only present after completion.

code.description: The executable code or script for the process

environment.description: The runtime environment identifier (e.g., python, node, bash)

extras.description: Additional metadata or configuration key-value pairs

created_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the process was created

completed_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the process completed. Null if never completed or currently running.

save.description: Whether to persist this process for future reference

lint.description: Whether to perform linting/validation on the code before execution

run.description: Whether to immediately execute the process upon creation

ProcessUpdate.description: Partial update schema for processes. All fields are optional.

description.description: Detailed description of what this process does

code.description: The executable code or script for the process

extras.description: Additional metadata or configuration key-value pairs

id.description: Unique identifier slug for the definition (alphanumeric, hyphens, and underscores only)

name.description: Human-readable display name for the definition

description.description: Comprehensive explanation of the definition's purpose and functionality
examples: REST API specification for payment processing with support for credit cards, ACH, and digital wallets

type.description: The specification format or schema type

specification_file.description: The binary content of the specification file (e.g., OpenAPI YAML/JSON, GraphQL schema)

source_url.description: Original URL where this definition was installed from. Populated automatically for registry-installed definitions. Used by the update endpoint.

DefinitionUpdate.description: Partial update schema for definitions. All fields are optional.

name.description: Human-readable display name for the definition

description.description: Comprehensive explanation of the definition's purpose

type.description: The specification format or schema type

specification_file.description: The binary content of the specification file

url.description: Direct URL to the API endpoint that returns the complete definition or module data (including metadata and files)

id.description: Unique identifier slug for the module (alphanumeric, hyphens, and underscores only)

name.description: Human-readable display name for the module

description.description: Comprehensive explanation of the module's functionality and use cases
examples: Isolated Docker-based sandbox environment for executing untrusted code with resource limits and network restrictions

type.description: The functional category of the module (sandbox=execution environment, language=runtime, proxy=network proxy, interceptor=request interceptor, hook=lifecycle hook)

wasm_file.description: The compiled WebAssembly binary file containing the module implementation

source_url.description: Original URL where this module was installed from. Populated automatically for registry-installed modules. Used by the update endpoint.

ModuleUpdate.description: Partial update schema for modules. All fields are optional.

name.description: Human-readable display name for the module

description.description: Comprehensive explanation of the module's functionality

type.description: The functional category of the module

stdout.description: Standard output from the process execution

stderr.description: Standard error output from the process execution

timestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the logs were captured

ProcessOutput.description: Dynamic output object from process execution. Structure varies based on process implementation.

message.description: Human-readable error message explaining what went wrong
examples: Cannot delete a process while it is in the 'running' state.

details.description: Additional structured error details or context

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of processes with optional filtering by status, environment, dates, and search query. Supports sorting and pagination.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query to filter processes by name, description, or ID (partial match, case-insensitive)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter processes by current execution status

parameters.name: exit_state
parameters.description: Filter processes by their final execution outcome

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: Filter processes created after this ISO 8601 timestamp (inclusive)

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: Filter processes created before this ISO 8601 timestamp (inclusive)

parameters.name: completed_after
parameters.description: Filter processes completed after this ISO 8601 timestamp (inclusive)

parameters.name: completed_before
parameters.description: Filter processes completed before this ISO 8601 timestamp (inclusive)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return per page

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of results to skip (for pagination). Use with limit to paginate through results.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Sort direction - ascending (oldest/lowest first) or descending (newest/highest first)

200.description: A list of processes matching the filter criteria.

post.summary: Create and optionally run a process
post.description: Create a new process with the provided code and configuration. Optionally lint and/or execute immediately.

422.description: Linting or validation failure. The code contains errors.

get.description: Retrieve complete information about a specific process including its current state, metadata, and timestamps.

404.description: Process not found with the specified PID.

put.description: Partially update an existing process. Only provided fields will be updated. Cannot modify a running process.

404.description: Process not found with the specified PID.

409.description: Conflict: Cannot modify a process that is currently running.

delete.description: Permanently delete a process. Cannot delete a running process - it must be terminated first.

404.description: Process not found with the specified PID.

409.description: Conflict: Cannot delete a process that is currently running.

get.description: Retrieve the stdout, stderr, and timestamp for a process's execution logs.

404.description: Process not found with the specified PID.

get.description: Retrieve the structured output data produced by the process (not execution logs). The structure is dynamic and depends on the process implementation. May support streaming in future versions.

200.description: Process output retrieved successfully. Structure varies by process.

404.description: Process not found with the specified PID.

post.summary: Send a signal to a process
post.description: Send control signals to manage process lifecycle (kill, instantiate, restart).

signal.description: Control signal: kill (terminate immediately), instantiate (initialize without running), restart (stop and start)

200.description: Signal sent successfully and process responded.

404.description: Process not found with the specified PID.

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of API definitions with optional filtering by type and search query. Supports sorting and pagination.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query to filter definitions by ID, name, or description (partial match, case-insensitive)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return per page

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of results to skip (for pagination)

200.description: A list of definitions matching the filter criteria.

post.description: Upload and register a new API definition with metadata and specification file.

400.description: Invalid request. Check the definition format and required fields.

409.description: Definition with this ID already exists. Use a different ID or update the existing definition.

get.description: Retrieve complete metadata and specification file content for a specific definition.

200.description: Definition retrieved successfully including metadata and specification file.

404.description: Definition not found with the specified ID.

put.description: Partially update an existing definition. Only provided fields will be updated.

400.description: Invalid request. Check the update payload format.

404.description: Definition not found with the specified ID.

delete.description: Permanently delete a definition. Cannot delete if currently in use by active processes.

404.description: Definition not found with the specified ID.

409.description: Cannot delete definition because it is currently in use by one or more processes.

post.description: Automatically fetch and update the definition from its original source_url. Only works for registry-installed definitions that have a source_url.

200.description: Definition updated successfully from source URL.

400.description: Definition does not have a source_url. Only registry-installed definitions can use this endpoint.

404.description: Definition not found with the specified ID.

502.description: Failed to fetch updated definition from source URL. The remote server may be unavailable.

post.description: Download and install a definition from a registry URL. The URL should point to an API endpoint that returns the complete definition data.

400.description: Invalid request or validation failure. The fetched definition may be malformed.

409.description: Definition with this ID already exists. Remove the existing definition first or use a different ID.

502.description: Failed to fetch definition from the provided URL. Check the URL and network connectivity.

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of WASM modules with optional filtering by type and search query. Supports sorting and pagination.

parameters.name: query

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return per page

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of results to skip (for pagination)

post.description: Upload and register a new WASM module with metadata and compiled binary file.

400.description: Invalid request. Check the module format and required fields.

409.description: Module with this ID already exists. Use a different ID or update the existing module.

get.description: Retrieve complete metadata and WASM binary content for a specific module.

200.description: Module retrieved successfully including metadata and WASM file.

404.description: Module not found with the specified ID.

put.description: Partially update an existing module. Only provided fields will be updated.

400.description: Invalid request. Check the update payload format.

404.description: Module not found with the specified ID.

delete.description: Permanently delete a module. Cannot delete if currently in use by active processes.

404.description: Module not found with the specified ID.

409.description: Cannot delete module because it is currently in use by one or more processes.

post.description: Automatically fetch and update the module from its original source_url. Only works for registry-installed modules that have a source_url.

200.description: Module updated successfully from source URL.

400.description: Module does not have a source_url. Only registry-installed modules can use this endpoint.
